title: Sandra Bullock from 'Miss Congeniality' to 'The Blind Side': Her career in photos
description: Sandra Bullock has been America's Sweetheart for decades. Look back through her career highlights in photos, from "The Blind Side" to "The Proposal."
content:
Sandra Bullock from 'Miss Congeniality' to 'The Blind Side': Her career in photos

Sandra Bullock has been America's Sweetheart for decades. Let's look back through her career highlights in photos. Here, she attends the U.K. screening of "The Lost City" at Cineworld Leicester Square on March 31, 2022, in London. Gareth Cattermole, Gareth Cattermole/Getty Images For Paramount Pictures

Sandra Bullock walks onto the stage in a bright orange dress at the 1999 VH-1/Vogue Fashion Awards Dec. 5, 1999, in New York. She introduced singer Beck, who performed at the show. TIMOTHY CLARY, AFP Via Getty Images

Sandra Bullock poses with her female star of the year award at the 2001 ShoWest Awards Ceremony at the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. Kevin Winter, Getty Images

Sandra Bullock waves as she arrives to the screening of director Barbet Schroeder's film "Murder By Numbers" during the 55th Cannes Film Festival on May 24, 2002. OLIVIER LABAN-MATTEI, AFP Via Getty Images

Sandra Bullock, left, poses with female impersonators at the premiere of Warner Bros.' "Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous" at the Chinese Theatre on March 23, 2005, in Los Angeles. Kevin Winter, Getty Images

Bradley Cooper, left, and Sandra Bullock arrive at the premiere of "All About Steve" held at Mann's Chinese Theater on Aug. 26, 2009, in Los Angeles. Kevin Winter, Getty Images

The 2010 awards season proved to be a boon for Sandra Bullock thanks to her role in "The Blind Side." She poses in the trophy room at the 67th Golden Globe Awards on Jan. 17, 2010, in Los Angeles. Robert Hanashiro, USA Today

Sandra Bullock wins the best actress award for "The Blind Side" during the 82nd annual Academy Awards show at the Kodak Theatre on March 7, 2010, in Hollywood, California. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY

Sandra Bullock, left, and Melissa McCarthy promote their film "The Heat" at The Colosseum at Caesars Palace during CinemaCon on April 18, 2013 in Las Vegas. Ethan Miller, Getty Images

Sandra Bullock and George Clooney attend the opening ceremony and "Gravity" premiere during the 70th Venice International Film Festival at the Palazzo del Cinema on Aug. 28, 2013, in Venice, Italy. Ian Gavan, Getty Images

Sandra Bullock poses in the press room during the 77th annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on Jan. 5, 2020 in Beverly Hills, California. Dan MacMedan, USA TODAY

From left: Patti Harrison, Daniel Radcliffe, Da'Vine Joy Randolph and Sandra Bullock attend the New York Tastemaker screening of "The Lost City" at the Whitby Hotel on March 14, 2022, in New York. Monica Schipper, Getty Images For Paramount Pictures
summary: Sandra Bullock, known for her roles in "Miss Congeniality" and "The Blind Side," has celebrated her career in photos. Her career began at the 1999 VH-1/Vogue Fashion Awards in New York, introducing singer Beck to her audience. She also received female star of the year award at the 2001 ShoWest Awards Ceremony in Las Vegas. Bullock won best actress award for her role in the 2010 awards season for her film "The Blind Side." She attended the U.K. screening of "The Lost City" at Cineworld Leicester Square on March 31, 2022, in London.
shortSummary: Sandra Bullock, known for her roles in films like "The Blind Side," has been photographed numerous times, including at Cannes and at Golden Globe Awards.
argos_summary: Sandra Bullock has enjoyed a celebrated career in Hollywood, known for her roles in films such as 'Miss Congeniality' and 'The Blind Side.' The article highlights key moments in her career through a series of photographs, showcasing her appearances at various events, award ceremonies, and film premieres from the late 1990s to 2022. Notable achievements include winning the Best Actress award for 'The Blind Side' at the 2010 Academy Awards.
